name: helium, crude stockpiling | helium, crude stockpiling | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11747/documentation

The only helium storage facility curently in operation is the Cliffside Storage Facility (also known as US National Helium Reserve) which is located in the United States, 19km far from Amarillo, Texas. ;USGS, Pacheco, N., Helium, 2000 (http://minerals.usgs.gov/minerals/pubs/commodity/helium/330400.pdf, accessed 20130404) ;Between 1960 and 1975 the strategy of the United States related to helium was to store this gas for the future uses. This strategy has changed by decision taken in 1996 that helium should no longer be accumulated. The figure below shows the quantities of helium sold versus quantities of helium recovered (USGS). It is obvious, that since 1999 growing amount of helium supplied to the market is coming from the reserves. These reserves are being close to be depleted, which causes lack of helium on the market and subsequently increased price (Reuters, Salmon, F., published 20130328, http://blogs.reuters.com/felix-salmon/2013/03/28/how-helium-is-like-mortgages/, accessed 20130405).;USGS, Pacheco, N., Helium, 2000 (http://minerals.usgs.gov/minerals/pubs/commodity/helium/330400.pdf, accessed 20130404) 

This activity starts with the helium, crude being pumped into the underground storage facility.

This activity delivers the service of helium, crude stockpiling.

exchanges.description:
Estimated. The Cliffside Storage Facility has a capacity of 1E+9m3 of helium gas. The storage itself (the "dome") is a natural underground cavity and as such did not require any transformation.

Based on aerial picture the transformed above the ground area has a size of app 0.69km2.

Estimated. The Cliffside Storage Facility has a capacity of 1E+9m3 of helium gas. The storage itself (the "dome") is a natural underground cavity and as such did not require any transformation.

Based on aerial picture the transformed above the ground area has a size of app 0.69km2. It is estimated, that half of this area is used for different kinds of building structures.

The storage facility is in operation since 1925 (Committee on the Impact of Selling the Federal Helium Reserve, Commission on Physical Sciences, Mathematics, and Applications, Commission on Engineering and Technical Systems, National Research Council, The Impact of Selling the Federal Helium Reserve, 2000).

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on information provided in the pump station production activity. The pump station is used as a proxy for different types of equipment (pumps, pipes, etc.) used in the storage facility. 

644546 m3/year is the capacity of the pump station
70 years is the life time of the pump station
(644546*70*0.167=) 7444506 kg of helium is the capacity over the whole lifetime
